definition: Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan

sentences.english: And actually Takeshima was taken from Japan during the Korean War.
sentences.chinese: 实际，竹岛是在朝鲜战争中从日本被夺走的。

sentences.english: South Korea’s government has asked that Japan’s refrain from referring to the Takeshima question.
sentences.chinese: 南韩政府已要求日本政府提及竹岛问题时，保持克制。

sentences.english: Takeshima by the ROK current actual control.
sentences.chinese: 竹岛当前由韩国实际控制。

sentences.english: Japan insists Dokdo should be called “Takeshima”.
sentences.chinese: 日本坚称独岛应该叫“竹岛”。

sentences.english: More probably the delay has something to do with the Takeshima islands.
sentences.chinese: 推迟更有可能是和竹岛有关。

definition: Dokdo (Japanese Takeshima 竹島|竹岛[Zhu2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan
Diaoyu Islands, claimed by China but controlled by Japan as the Senkaku Islands, also called the Pinnacle Islands
Ryukyu Islands/Okinawa 沖繩|冲绳[Chong1 sheng2] and other islands of modern Japan
Penglai county level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台, Shandong/Penglai, one of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, abode of immortals/by extension, fairyland
Yingzhou, easternmost of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, home of immortals and source of elixir of immortality
Kuril Islands, archipelago in Sakhalin, far-eastern Russia
Ryūkyū/refers to the Ryūkyū Islands 琉球群島|琉球群岛[Liu2 qiu2 Qun2 dao3] stretching from Japan to Taiwan/Liuchiu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Tsushima Island, between Japan and South Korea
